page.title: 11NATURAL HISTORY
page.content: NATURAL HISTORY IN LLANSANNAN. The varied geology of the area,with its hills and valleys,allows for a rich local ecology.There is a splendid variety of wild life,but very few recognised local natural historians. A wealth of wild flowers can be found along the narrow lane verges,but hardly any along the main road verges, due to seasonal weed-spraying.All types of indigenous Hawks,Kestrels and Owls are present.Curlews and Plovers arrive in the Spring;Herons and Wild-geese nest in the area.All the smaller mammals,exept deer and wildcat,are present.Bats,lizards,grass snakes,frogs and toads are often seen whilst the trout is the fish that is usually caught in the local rivers.The area recorded is well known for its natural beauty.
